00028 #ifndef __BLI_ARGS_H__
00029 #define __BLI_ARGS_H__

00036 struct bArgs;
00037 typedef struct bArgs bArgs;
00038 
00039 /* returns the number of extra arguments consumed by the function. 0 is normal value, -1 stops parsing arguments, other negative indicates skip */
00040 typedef int (*BA_ArgCallback)(int argc, const char **argv, void *data);
00041 
00042 struct bArgs *BLI_argsInit(int argc, const char **argv);
00043 void BLI_argsFree(struct bArgs *ba);
00044 
00045 /* pass starts at 1, -1 means valid all the time
00046  * short_arg or long_arg can be null to specify no short or long versions
00047  * */
00048 void BLI_argsAdd(struct bArgs *ba, int pass, const char *short_arg, const char *long_arg, const char *doc, BA_ArgCallback cb, void *data);
00049 /* short_case and long_case specify if those arguments are case specific */
00050 void BLI_argsAddCase(struct bArgs *ba, int pass, const char *short_arg, int short_case, const char *long_arg, int long_case, const char *doc, BA_ArgCallback cb, void *data);
00051 
00052 void BLI_argsParse(struct bArgs *ba, int pass, BA_ArgCallback default_cb, void *data);
00053 
00054 void BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(struct bArgs *ba, const char *arg);
00055 void BLI_argsPrintOtherDoc(struct bArgs *ba);
00056 
00057 void BLI_argsPrint(struct bArgs *ba);
00058 const char **BLI_argsArgv(struct bArgs *ba);
